alert.note: Alert for Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 22 at 12:08AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Pennsylvania, including the following county, Erie. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1205 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Corry, Union City and Elgin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
